duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage or perform engineering projects such as roads, airports, railroads, bridges, pipelines, tunnels, and water and sewage systems.
Supervise professional level employees and may also supervise some para-professional employees.
Set goals and objectives for team members for achievement of operational results.
Ensure identification and correct allocation of structural civil works system requirements.
Lead the identification and resolution of the technical Interfaces between Civil Works and technological Systems/subsystems and third parties.
Apply quality procedures for the emissions of the documents at every stage of the design.
Ensure there are no risks not assessed with respect to the safety of the works designed and compared to budgeted costs.
Verify the interfaces alignment and manage each step properly.
Identify and manage Civil Work Interface with civil contractors.
Use BIM for interfaces definition and management, as part of the project delivery strategy according to the Engineering Management Plan.
Prepare Purchase Technical Specification (PTS) according to contract needs.
Provide technical support for contract matters.
Define/consolidate and manage requirements and interfaces using Requirement Traceability Matrix and the Interface Registers tools, implemented in BIM (Building Information Modelling) context.
Manage contractors and sub-contractor activities: contract requirements and design processes-control.
Experience in construction and Test & Commissioning phases.
Basic experience in BIM context in accordance with ISO 19650.
Use common Structural software and civil works design software.

education_certification.credential: Structural Civil Engineering University Degree or Equivalent Technical Background
